words.translation: Nun|By the pen|and what|they write

translations.15: Nũn. By the pen and what everyone writes

words.translation: Not|you (are)|by (the) Grace|(of) your Lord|a madman

translations.15: By the grace of your Lord, you ˹O Prophet˺ are not insane

words.translation: And indeed|for you|surely (is) a reward|without|end

translations.15: You will certainly have a never-ending reward

words.translation: And indeed you|surely (are)|(of) a moral character|great

translations.15: And you are truly ˹a man˺ of outstanding character

words.translation: So soon you will see|and they will see

translations.15: Soon you and the pagans will see

words.translation: Which of you|(is) the afflicted one

translations.15: which of you is mad

words.translation: Indeed|your Lord|He|(is) most knowing|of (he) who|has strayed|from|His way|and He|(is) most knowing|of the guided ones

translations.1: Innaa Rabbaka Huwa a'lamu biman dalla 'an sabeelihee Wa-Huwa a'lamu bilmuhtadeen
translations.15: Surely your Lord ˹alone˺ knows best who has strayed from His Way and who is ˹rightly˺ guided

words.translation: So (do) not|obey|the deniers

translations.15: So do not give in to the deniers

words.translation: They wish|that|you should compromise|so they would compromise

translations.15: They wish you would compromise so they would yield ˹to you˺

words.translation: And (do) not|obey|every|habitual swearer|worthless

translations.15: And do not obey the despicable, vain oath-taker

words.translation: Defamer|going about|with malicious gossip

translations.15: slanderer, gossip-monger

words.translation: A preventer|of (the) good|transgressor|sinful

translations.15: withholder of good, transgressor, evildoer

words.translation: Cruel|after|(all) that|utterly useless

translations.15: brute, and—on top of all that—an illegitimate child

words.translation: Because|(he) is|a possessor|(of) wealth|and children

translations.15: Now, ˹simply˺ because he has been blessed with ˹abundant˺ wealth and children

words.translation: When|are recited|to him|Our Verses|he says|Stories|(of) the former (people)

translations.1: Izaa tutlaa 'alaihi aayaatunaa qaala asaateerul awwaleen
translations.15: whenever Our revelations are recited to him, he says, “Ancient fables!”

words.translation: We will brand him|on|the snout

translations.15: We will soon mark his snout

words.translation: Indeed We|have tried them|as|We tried|(the) companions|(of) the garden|when|they swore|to pluck its fruit|(in the) morning

translations.1: Innaa balawnaahum kamaa balawnaaa As-haabal jannati iz 'aqsamoo la-yasri-munnahaa musbiheen
translations.15: Indeed, We have tested those ˹Meccans˺ as We tested the owners of the garden—when they swore they would surely harvest ˹all˺ its fruit in the early morning

words.translation: And not|making exception

translations.15: leaving no thought for Allah’s Will

words.translation: So there came|upon it|a visitation|from|your Lord|while they|were asleep

translations.1: Fataafa 'alaihaa taaa'i-fum mir rabbika Wa-hum naaa'imoon
translations.15: Then it was struck by a torment from your Lord while they slept

words.translation: So it became|as if reaped

translations.15: so it was reduced to ashes

words.translation: And they called one another|(at) morning

translations.15: Then by daybreak they called out to each other

words.translation: That|Go early|to|your crop|if|you would|pluck (the) fruit

translations.1: Anigh doo 'alaa harsikum in kuntum saarimeen
translations.15: ˹saying,˺ “Go early to your harvest, if you want to pick ˹all˺ the fruit.”

words.translation: So they went|while they|lowered (their) voices

translations.15: So they went off, whispering to one another

words.translation: That|Not|will enter it|today|upon you|any poor person

translations.15: “Do not let any poor person enter your garden today.”

words.translation: And they went early|with|determination|able

translations.15: And they proceeded early, totally fixated on their purpose

words.translation: But when|they saw it|they said|Indeed we|(are) surely lost

translations.15: But when they saw it ˹devastated˺, they cried, “We must have lost ˹our˺ way

words.translation: Nay!|We|(are) deprived

translations.15: In fact, we have been deprived ˹of our livelihood˺.”

words.translation: Said|(the) most moderate of them|Did not|I tell|you|Why not|you glorify (Allah)

translations.1: Qaala awsatuhum alam aqul lakum law-laa tusabbihoon
translations.15: The most sensible of them said, “Did I not urge you to say, ‘Allah willing.’?”

words.translation: They said|Glory be|(to) our Lord!|Indeed we|[we] were|wrongdoers

translations.1: Qaaloo subhaana rabbinaaa innaa kunnaa zaalimeen
translations.15: They replied, “Glory be to our Lord! We have truly been wrongdoers.”

words.translation: Then approached|some of them|to|others|blaming each other

translations.15: Then they turned on each other, throwing blame

words.translation: They said|O woe to us!|Indeed we|[we] were|transgressors

translations.15: They said, “Woe to us! We have certainly been transgressors

words.translation: Perhaps|our Lord|[that]|will substitute for us|a better|than it|Indeed we|to|our Lord|turn devoutly

translations.1: Asaa rabbunaaa any yubdilanaa khairam minhaaa innaaa ilaa rabbinaa raaghiboon
translations.15: We trust our Lord will give us a better garden than this, ˹for˺ we are indeed turning to our Lord with hope.”

words.translation: Such|(is) the punishment|And surely the punishment|(of) the Hereafter|(is) greater|if|they|know

translations.1: Kazaalikal azaab, Wa-la'azaabul aakhirati akbar; law kaanoo ya'lamoon
translations.15: That is the ˹way of Our˺ punishment ˹in this world˺. But the punishment of the Hereafter is certainly far worse, if only they knew

words.translation: Indeed|for the righteous|with|their Lord|(are) Gardens|(of) Delight

translations.15: Indeed, the righteous will have the Gardens of Bliss with their Lord

words.translation: Then will We treat|the Muslims|like the criminals

translations.15: Should We then treat those who have submitted like the wicked

words.translation: What|(is) for you|How|(do) you judge

translations.15: What is the matter with you? How do you judge

words.translation: Or|(is) for you|a book|wherein|you learn

translations.15: Or do you have a scripture, in which you read

words.translation: That|for you|therein|what|you choose

translations.15: that you will have whatever you choose

words.translation: Or|(do) you have|oaths|from us|reaching|to|(the) Day|(of) the Resurrection|That|for you|(is) what|you judge

translations.1: Am lakum aymaanun 'alainaa baalighatun ilaa yawmil qiyaamati inna lakum lamaa tahkumoon
translations.15: Or do you have oaths binding on Us until the Day of Judgment that you will have whatever you decide

words.translation: Ask them|which of them|for that|(is) responsible

translations.15: Ask them ˹O Prophet˺ which of them can guarantee all that

words.translation: Or|(do) they have|partners|Then let them bring|their partners|if|they are|truthful

translations.1: Am lahum shurakaaa'u fal-ya'too bishurakaaa-'ihim in kaanoo saadiqeen
translations.15: Or do they have associate-gods ˹supporting this claim˺? Then let them bring forth their associate-gods, if what they say is true

words.translation: (The) Day|will be uncovered|from|the shin|and they will be called|to|prostrate|but not|they will be able

translations.1: Yawma yukshafu 'am saaqinw Wa-yud'awna ilas sujoodi falaa yastatee'oon
translations.15: ˹Beware of˺ the Day the Shin ˹of Allah˺ will be bared, and the wicked will be asked to prostrate, but they will not be able to do so

words.translation: Humbled|their eyes|will cover them|humiliation|And indeed|they were|called|to|prostrate|while they|(were) sound

translations.1: Khaashi'atan absaaruhum tarhaquhum zillatunw Wa-qad kaanoo yud'awna ilas sujoodi Wa-hum saalimoon
translations.15: with eyes downcast, totally covered with disgrace. For they were ˹always˺ called to prostrate ˹in the world˺ when they were fully capable ˹but they chose not to˺

words.translation: So leave Me|and whoever|denies|this|Statement|We will progressively lead them|from|where|not|they know

translations.1: Fazarnee Wa-many yukazzibu bihaazal hadeesi sanastad-rijuhum min haisu laa ya'lamoon
translations.15: So leave to Me ˹O Prophet˺ those who reject this message. We will gradually draw them to destruction in ways they cannot comprehend

words.translation: And I will give respite|to them|Indeed|My plan|(is) firm

translations.15: I ˹only˺ delay their end for a while, but My planning is flawless

words.translation: Or|you ask them|a payment|so they|from|(the) debt|(are) burdened

translations.1: Am tas'aluhum ajran fahum min maghramin musqaloon
translations.15: Or are you asking them for a reward ˹for the message˺ so that they are overburdened by debt

words.translation: Or|(is) with them|the unseen|so they|write it

translations.15: Or do they have access to ˹the Record in˺ the unseen, so they copy it ˹for all to see˺

words.translation: So be patient|for (the) decision|(of) your Lord|and (do) not|be|like (the) companion|(of) the fish|when|he called out|while he|(was) distressed

translations.1: Fasbir lihukmi rabbika Wa-laa takun kasaahibil hoot; iz naadaa Wa-huwa makzoom
translations.15: So be patient with your Lord’s decree, and do not be like ˹Jonah,˺ the Man of the Whale, who cried out ˹to Allah˺, in total distress

words.translation: If not|that|overtook him|a Favor|from|his Lord|surely he would have been thrown|onto (the) naked shore|while he|(was) blamed

translations.1: Law-laaa an tadaara-kahoo ni'matum mir rabbihee lanubiza bil'araaa'i Wa-huwa mazmoom
translations.15: Had he not been shown grace by his Lord, he would have certainly been cast onto the open ˹shore˺, still blameworthy

words.translation: But chose him|his Lord|and made him|of|the righteous

translations.15: Then his Lord chose him, making him one of the righteous

words.translation: And indeed|would almost|those who|disbelieve|surely make you slip|with their eyes|when|they hear|the Message|and they say|Indeed he|(is) surely mad

translations.1: Wa-iny yakaadul lazeena kafaroo la-yuzliqoonaka biabsaarihim lammaa sami'uz Zikra Wa-yaqooloona innahoo lamajnoon
translations.15: The disbelievers would almost cut you down with their eyes when they hear ˹you recite˺ the Reminder, and say, “He is certainly a madman.”

words.translation: And not|it (is)|but|a Reminder|to the worlds

translations.15: But it is simply a reminder to the whole world
